intro: Plagiobothrys hirtus, commonly known as the hairy leaf bladderwort, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open, disturbed habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
